alert.note: Alert for Custer; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 26 at 8:08PM CST until February 26 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN WOODS...NORTH CENTRAL CUSTER...NORTHERN BLAINE... DEWEY...WESTERN MAJOR AND SOUTHEASTERN WOODWARD COUNTIES... At 808 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles south of Avard to 12 miles southeast of Waynoka to 6 miles southeast of Seiling to near Putnam, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Fairview, Taloga, Waynoka, Seiling, Canton, Longdale, Hitchcock, Oakwood, Putnam, Canton Lake, Orion, Chester, Avard, Eagle City, Cestos, Hucmac, Southard and Bouse Junction. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
